column4: how could install and then start a vnc service from the ubuntu console?
try vino-server
are you using a WM err?
what a WM err is?
actually I'm connected to a desktop machine using ssh
ok hang on
ok
check it http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-266981.html
I see that this program uses lot of gnome thing in its commands. I've installed Kubuntu. Does it matters?
hmm should work the same with the program
ok
the instructions say to make this, but I can not find that route gconftool-2 -s -t bool /desktop/gnome/remote_access/enabled true
why are you saying route gconftool
that's what the instructions say buddy
just leave out the route before gconftool
how could I know in which port the vnc server is listening to?
I think it's like 3192 err
vnc is 5900
make sure you have an exception in your firewall or iptables
that's the deal :-/ know I have to connect to the router through telnet and do all that stuff :S
you may have to enable port forwarding if you're behind a router
actually, that's the reason I wanted to start the VNC Server, because of the annoying work of configuring the router through telnet :S
have you tried vino-server & in ssh
